body:
I haven't quite managed to replicate your exact problem, but there is clearly something weird going on!

```
$ rclone copy -v Dir onedrive:Dir
2017/03/30 10:40:36 INFO  : One drive root 'Dir': Modify window is 1s
2017/03/30 10:40:36 INFO  : One drive root 'Dir': Waiting for checks to finish
2017/03/30 10:40:36 INFO  : One drive root 'Dir': Waiting for transfers to finish
2017/03/30 10:40:37 INFO  : Sub Dir/test.txt: Copied (new)
2017/03/30 10:40:37 INFO  : 
Transferred:      6 Bytes (3 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:        1.9s
$ rclone lsd onedrive:'/Dir/'
          -1 2017-03-30 09:40:38         0 Sub Dir
          -1 2017-03-30 09:40:39         1 Sub+Dir
```

If I run the integration tests they fail with lots of errors like this

```
	            	expected: []string{"file name.txt"}
	            	received: []string{"file+name.txt"}
```

So this indicates that something has changed at OneDrive, since I ran the integration tests for the 1.36 release and they worked fine then.

Needs more investigation!

 @yonjah - have you got time to look at this?

OK I think i figured it out.
But it is really weird the only reason for this happening now is onedrive changing their api.
Unless the old code base used an old go version but I also tested this issue with old version of rclone (1.35) and I can reproduce this issue.

It seems like all the escape methods for path are using `net/url` `QueryEscape` instead of `PathEscape`
`QueryEscape` escapes spaces as '+' which onedirve interprets as literal '+' path escape is escaping them as '%20' which seems to be working fine.

Unfortunately  `PathEscape` is only available in go 1.8
I'll submit a pull request with the changes to onedrive but this will not work without go 1.8 and I assume before upgrading go full integration tests needs to be done on all remotes which is probably somehting that someone with more experience in the code base should be doing

issue.title: changed QueryEscape to PathEscape

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body: fixes #1296 but requires upgrading go to 1.8

body: OK I'll try and see if I can do the changes this weekend
On a side note - https://github.com/OneDrive/onedrive-api-docs/issues/555 deployed two days ago :speak_no_evil:
@yonjah that is surely related - well spotted!

I made the changes so it wont use 1.8 api.
~~But when I run the integration tests one test fails for taking too long.
I tried running the test without the changes and I'm getting the same failure.
I'm not sure if this is something else that changed with OneDrive or just something specific
to my machine.~~
Never mind I had my regular backups running which slowed everything. tests seem to pass.

@ncw could you explain the reason for supporting multiple go version ? I'm still trying to understand go but I would have thought since it's all compiled and pack that you'd only care about the one version you choose to develop for

issue.title: Cannot read source directory on v1.36

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Below the log output from a sync job. On v1.36 (including latest beta v1.36.b20) I get several messages of failure to read from source directory and the process would stop after three such failed attempts. It would typically be a different directory for each of the three errors.

However, when performing the same job with v1.35, the source directory is correctly read and the files are being sync'ed across.
Same config file, same environment, same source and destination et all... (Ubuntu 16.04)

Details here:
##### // Using v1.36 ... sync from source=onedrive to dest=google_cloud_storage
```
2017/04/04 07:24:35 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 0 errors and: error reading source directory "Music/aKING/Dutch Courage": directory not found
```
##### // Using v1.35 ... sync from source=onedrive to dest=google_cloud_storage
```
2017/04/04 13:15:48 One drive root '': Reading "Music/aKING/Dutch Courage/"
2017/04/04 13:15:59 Music/aKING/Dutch Courage/AKING - Decomposing Lullaby.mp3: Copied (new)
2017/04/04 13:16:01 Music/aKING/Dutch Courage/AKING - Holy Train.mp3: Copied (new)
2017/04/04 13:16:03 Music/aKING/Dutch Courage/AKING - I Believe.mp3: Copied (new)
2017/04/04 13:16:06 Music/aKING/Dutch Courage/AKING - Lonely Hands.mp3: Copied (new)
2017/04/04 13:16:08 Music/aKING/Dutch Courage/AKING - My Last Words.mp3: Copied (new)
2017/04/04 13:16:10 Music/aKING/Dutch Courage/AKING - Once I Arrive.mp3: Copied (new)
2017/04/04 13:16:11 One drive root '': Finished reading "Music/aKING/Dutch Courage/"
2017/04/04 13:16:13 Music/aKING/Dutch Courage/AKING - Safe As Houses.mp3: Copied (new)
2017/04/04 13:16:14 Music/aKING/Dutch Courage/AKING - Shine Your Light.mp3: Copied (new)
2017/04/04 13:16:17 Music/aKING/Dutch Courage/AKING - The Dance.mp3: Copied (new)
2017/04/04 13:16:19 Music/aKING/Dutch Courage/AKING - Thirsty For Love.mp3: Copied (new)
```
##### // Exact command used
```bash
./rclone --config /root/.config/rclone/rclone.conf --ignore-size --verbose --stats 0 sync f_onedrive:/ gcloud:f_backup
```

Thanks for any help

body: I am having the same issue since last week as well. When can we expect a fix? This is effectively doubling up my space requirement for the backup on onedrive making rclone pretty much unusable.

@aas2234 This has been fixed in the referenced pull request -
https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/1299

ncw has been a bit less active than usual this month so I'm not sure when he'll have the time to check it properly. but it might take a bit longer for the merge to happen.

if you think its worth it you can pull the changes and build rclone locally (I've been running the fixed version for a few days now and didn't notice any issues) but it still not fully tested so you might prefer to wait for the next release.

@yonjah 
Hey yonjah, what are the steps to build rclone with your changes?
I have already cloned the repo and applied your pull request locally, what should I do now?
Obs: I have already configured the GOPATH.

@chmercesmoreira  if you followed the instructions here to setup your development environment - 
https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
in `rclone` repo main folder you can run -
`go run rclone.go --help`
and see if it works.
You can also run any other `rclone` command the same way. their will be a small delay to run the build but it is not very noticeable.
You can also run a proper build by running `go build` in the same path which will create the `rclone` binary on the same path 

Just be sure to test it on a less important remote first especially if its you never set the environment before.
I would also backup `rclone` config path where the token is kept just in case
